Job_Title: Field Marketing Specialist, Southeast Asia - Tableau (12 Months Contract)
Job_Descriptions: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Marketing Job Details This is a 12 months contract position. The Field Marketing Specialist supports the growth aspirations of the Tableau business in Southeast Asia (SEA), by planning and executing impactful demand generation programs that drive results in whitespace acquisition, account expansion, and community adoption. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, and fast growing business. Primary Responsibilities: Create and deploy innovative marketing programs and at scale, to build awareness and demand for visual analytics and data management solutions across focused markets in SEA Operationalize and provide end-to-end marketing campaign support for SEA field activations, as well for global and APAC marketing initiatives as required Collaborate with the SEA sales organization and our partners with a growth mindset, to understand their mission and develop the best solution to achieve a common purpose Leverage the expertise of global and APAC marketing functions to drive excellence in campaign execution, digital marketing, customer marketing, industry marketing, and more Define and lead special projects such as the SEA community engagement program with Tableau champions Explore third-party/industry partnerships across SEA to extend the reach and effectiveness of field activations Take accountability of project deliverables, and adopt a data-driven approach to analyzing results and offering insights and recommendations to improve future activations Other duties may be assigned in alignment with business priorities. Knowledge and Skill Requirements: Professional certification in Marketing Experienced in B2B or Technology Marketing Has foundational understanding and familiarity with marketing campaign development and deployment processes, and with demonstrable success A keen learner and team player with a positive attitude to deliver great work and a focus on customer success A strong communicator with excellent written and verbal communication skills Data-curious by nature, and loves to explore data to drive insight-led marketing Familiarity with marketing technology stack such as Eloqua, Drupal, and Adobe Creative Suite will be an advantage Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc. #LI-JL3 #LI-Y Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

Job_Descriptions: Company Daimler South East Asia Pte Ltd daimler.com Designation Intern - Business Process Analyst & Communications Date Listed 21 Feb 2022 Job Type Entry Level / Junior Executive Intern/TS Job Period From Apr 2022, For At Least 6 Months Profession Marketing / Public Relations Industry Others Location Name Gateway Drive, Westgate tower office, Singapore Address 1 Gateway Dr, Singapore 608531 Map Allowance / Remuneration $1,000 - 2,000 monthly Company Profile Daimler Singapore is a regional hub for Daimler AG. The office in Singapore oversees business development of the passenger and commercial vehicle business in Singapore, South Asia & South Pacific region and is the Asia-Pacific &African headquarters for the financial services division. The Group maintains a large and significant IT hub in Singapore as well as a regional logistics center, which supplies to the Asia-Pacific Region. We offer you the opportunity to gain exposure and experience on how a multinational corporation is driven by diversity, commitment and passion – especially in the company that invented the automobile and has been innovating ever since. You can look forward to a series of varied assignments within challenging projects where you work independently and give you insights into the organizational and productive processes of a globally operating automobile manufacturer. Job Description Description Join us to digitalize the retail world of Mercedes-Benz. We are a young and dynamic team that is driving the development of the sales process of the future with a strong focus on providing memorable moments to our customer with modern processes, applications and an integrated system landscape. Our main task is to overlook the sales & business process blueprint while taking ownership of the strategic development of our IT systems for Mercedes-Benz Cars across Region Overseas. We are looking for a motivated individual who helps us to communicate our vision to our customers in the markets across the globe and to our stakeholders in the headquarter environment. You will support a team of product owners to make the product strategy and big picture visible, understandable and tangible to a wide, internal audience. In addition, you will push for communication of our initiatives via our internal company communication platform: the social intranet. Your Main Tasks will include: Support product owners in documenting processes and process improvements Creation of user guides to capture new product features in our monthly releases Management of the department’s social intranet page Design and development of communication plan Plan, maintain and update the social intranet on a daily basis Development of ideas for user-generated content Creation of content (articles, videos, interviews, etc.) Ability to story tell and build excitement around key initiatives Editing of images and videos Best practice research on content creation Measure customer engagement Preferred Skillsets Very good ability to comprehend complex topics and ability to explain those to a non-familiar audience Excellent communication skills; both written and spoken Creativity Passion and ease of writing Basic knowledge in image editing programs (Adobe Photoshop, InDesign or similar) and video editing software (Adobe Premiere or similar) Interest in process mapping, communications, corporate communications, PR Eye for detail Basic technical understanding preferred Highly motivated independent worker with minimum guidance required Ability to work in an international and intercultural context Application Instructions Please apply for this position by submitting your resumes directly to ***************@daimler.com Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. As a Client Advisor (CA), you will anticipate and manage the enquiries from our clients and through appropriate clienteling, meet their needs through relevant product recommendations and upselling. Our clients will engage via an omni channel platform where the CA is expected to deliver exceptional client experience whilst developing a trusted and connected relationship with them. The CA will be expected to be resourceful and develop relevant solutions to clients by utilizing relevant resources to fulfill their queries and purchases. Operational Excellence Build sound knowledge of clients during interactions via the various channels on the platform, to ensure a personalized interaction and ultimately establish a credible rapport Achieve our day-to-day operational requirements within the established objectives and standards (and not limited to): Sales targets Contact handling across omni-channels 75% on inbound 25% outbound (i.e. outreach calls) Clientelling Service SLAs Service Standards (e.g. Quality & Voice) Productivity Compliance regulations (including but not limited to handling of personal information) Actively supports all new product launches, marketing campaigns and any other initiatives that drive sales Deliver extraordinary service on inbound and outbound calls / emails / social media servicing / chat messages and any other channels that may be established Adopt the required strategy to deliver expected targets are met in terms of sales and client experience; by: Discovering our clients to understand their needs and lifestyle Recommending relevant products to each client Cross-selling and upselling Outreach to clients; daring to propose silhouettes using tools such as wardrobing Address general and product-specific inquiries from our clients and provide clear and concise information as needed Use tools and resources to identify and anticipate client needs, in a commitment to deliver a one-point contact resolution Track all clienteling activities using the ICON app to communicate with clients, build relationship, and convert Handle and resolve client’s queries, requests, and feedback (including complaints) promptly and professionally; using the expected service language. Escalate to Team Manager as required All complaints, including those resolved during the call, must be shared with both Team Manager and Client Experience Manager; to provide an opportunity for the Client Services team to learn and consistently improve Well-versed on the operational guidelines and processes Service Excellence Ensure that collectively as a team we achieve our Post-Call survey targets; or any other quality metrics consistently As a brand ambassador, represent the brand in a professional manner that builds on client experience Have a sound understanding of our products and services to better fulfill clients needs Actively seek for the latest and most updated information relative to luxury lifestyle trends and other luxury brands’ product and services, to be able to support and understand the needs of our clients and their expectations Strives to leave the client with a positive client experience after every contact Required Competencies Strong ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment Sales driven with excellent client servicing skills Excellent communication skills in English and another language (i.e. Mandarin, Thai) – both written and verbal Self motivated, highly resourceful and solution-oriented Strong problem solving skills with an innovative mindset; always looking for new ways to enhance client experience Ability to function independently whilst with the team at the same time, anticipate and react to frequently changing business and operating climate Required Work Experience Minimum of 3 years sales experience, preferably within an omni-channel call-centre environment; (ideally with experience in the luxury segment) Strong background in the service industry Exposure to platforms that supports Calls, Emails, Chats, Social Media Working knowledge of MS Office applications Work Location Tampines (East Singapore) Working Hours Requirement Rotational shift including Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays

Job_Title: Medium Business APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager
Job_Descriptions: Medium Business APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager Assessing market trends, quantifying opportunities and developing marketing programs, Field Marketing at Dell Technologies is at the forefront of customer engagement. Responsible for a specific location, department or product, our teams drive marcom strategy – from making budget recommendations to defining roadmaps and informing content themes. Interacting directly with customers and utilizing third-party customer data, they provide Dell’s product marketing and messaging team with game-changing feedback. At the highest level, they develop and drive marketing policies and activities, from market research through brand management and product development to pricing. Join us as a MB APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager on our Marketing team in SINGAPORE to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a part of the MB APJ Central Marketing team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the APJ online marketing campaigns for the mid-market segment. Your role would be to drive online demand and engagement through marketing tactics for MB audience. You will: Development and execution of the cutting-edge Online marketing plan for APJ Medium Business driving incremental revenue, customer registrations and new buyers Definition and drive of right marketing mix for online including Digital, E-shots, and other tactics pushing promotional offers and eCommerce value proposition with a consistent online Customer Journey Deliver digital performance to meet the core financial goals of the team with available budget and Vendor Funding allocation. Apply a deep understanding of emerging online demand generation strategies to increase revenues and enhance online conversion. Build a strong partnership with International and APJ eCommerce, Merchandising and Digital Teams Collaboration with Mediacom (digital agency) team to ensure the successful and innovative implementation of MB APJ Online Digital Strategy. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Deep understanding of the media and advertising landscape, digital tactics and technologies and project management skills and drive for results Experience in transactional online marketing, driving traffic acquisition, conversion, A/B testing and ability to interpret data and experience in running customer acquisition, revenue conversion and retention campaigns Good overview of Dell’s solution portfolio and experience working with agencies Creative, constantly look for new approaches and ability to work in fast-paced environment and deal with ambiguity Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business Deep understanding of IT market dynamics Experience working in an international matrixed, complex organization Key Relationships MB APJ & International Marketing teams APJ Digital Marketing team Global Marketing & production teams APJ eCommerce team APJ CS & IS Merchandising team Vendor funding, calming and compliancy team External agencies: media partners and creative agencies Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. Job Summary: As an Application Security Engineer, you will be responsible for planning AppSec roadmap, standardisation of AppSec practices and solutions, and delivery of AppSec professional services to our application teams. The AppSec professional services range from providing AppSec consultancy to application teams, delivery of security assessments to training application teams to uplift their AppSec capabilities. Key Responsibilities: Study and propose AppSec roadmap to uplift the way apps security is practised today. Develop secure application development practices, standards, guidelines, and solutions with the aim to standardise and raise the AppSec practices of our application teams. Write / Train up the Business Analysts to write security acceptance criteria in user stories Train up the Software Engineers to write security unit tests and perform secure coding assessments Conduct App Penetration testing and Vulnerability assessment Work with DevOps team to improve security in the CI\CD pipeline Define the communication and education framework to raise the AppSec awareness, capabilities and competencies of security champions. Provide security guidance to Engineering and Product teams Perform AppSec assessments for selected applications using a combination of threat modelling, vulnerability research, code scanning, application security testing and recommendation of proper remediation actions. Job Requirements: Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in (web or mobile-based application security). Certification in CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) and/or CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor) is a plus. Strong interest and passion for the field of infocomm security, specifically in the area of application security. Familiar with application security review and testing approaches/methodologies in both waterfall and agile application development. Familiar with the concept of CI/CD and DevOps, and how security testings can be integrated and automated as part of software delivery pipelines. Able to recommend use of appropriate AppSec tools (e.g. static code scanners, dynamic scanners, etc) and assist apps teams in adopting these tools. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Proactive self-starter with an analytical and creative mind. Result and customer oriented with multi-tasking capabilities. Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation and negotiation skills. #LI-CTSAPAC

Administrative assistance and support related to all processes (immigration, tax, corporate housing, case management, travel, meetings and events) within Mobility services to ensure smooth delivery of mobility operations. What makes us Qlik Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes. We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 38,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you! How you will spend your time as our next Contract Specialist This position will be responsible for handling transactional work for APAC to ensure transactions achieve business goals within acceptable risk tolerances and in accordance with corporate policies.  Transactional work may include non-disclosure and data privacy agreements, vendor agreements, license transfers, assignments, RFP responses, marketing agreements, consulting agreements and SOWs. This position will work closely with field sales, field marketing, procurement as well as finance team members.  Additional responsibilities may include assistance with contract management, export control compliance, and support for projects as needed. Responsibilities Review and negotiate non-disclosure agreements, vendor agreements and other agreements described above in APAC Manage the review of customer RFP submissions, responses and questions with all stakeholders, including Pre-Sales, Sales, Sales Ops, and Legal. Work with Sales Operations or Finance to review or prepare license transfers, assignment agreements and assist with vendor registrations and data or security addendums. Help manage contract repository, contract forms, and facilitate contract execution. Assist the US and EMEA Legal Team with other transactional work as needed and help to manage intake process. Develop efficiencies to manage large or fluctuating workload. Develop close working relationship with field sales, field marketing, IT, procurement and Finance teams. Understand commercial trends in contracts. You will be successful if you have the following skills Ability to negotiate and review contracts, including NDAs and vendor agreements. Efficient time manage skills and ability to handle large volume. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Sound judgment, and strong interpersonal, project management and organizational skills Attention to detail. Good business acumen. Ability to work in a team environment is a must. You will thrive if you have the following qualifications Bachelor equivalent mandatory. Minimum of 3 years experience as a paralegal, contract specialist, contract manager or legal contractor handling contract review and negotiation.  Junior attorney with some transactional experience will also be considered. This candidate will be an efficient and organized worker with an ability to multitask on a multitude of matters under significant time pressure. He/she will be highly motivated, detail-oriented, and attracted to challenging opportunities within a rapidly growing environment. Business level English is mandatory. Fluency in Chinese or Japanese is a plus. Strong proficiency in MS Word. Our way of giving back To our communities, to the world, and to you is a core part of the culture at Qlik. We encourage our employees to participate in our numerous Corporate Responsibility Program initiatives. Location/Mobility The role is located in Singapore. Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means. Qlik is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any protected category or characteristic.  We value the diversity of our workforce. If you need assistance due to disability during the application and/or recruiting process, please contact us via the Accessibility Request Form #LI-KW #LI-AG, #associate

DESCRIPTION Job summary AWS is seeking a Regional Account Manager to lead our relationships with Global Financial Services customers. The Regional Account Manager will own customer relationships with a globally significant institution with coverage responsibilities focused across APAC. The Regional Account Manager will be responsible for providing global business leadership and management of the global customer relationship as well as of each of the Global Account teams that report to them. These teams will build and maintain strategic relationships, develop and manage opportunities, monitor deployment projects and engage virtual resources globally. Key job responsibilities • Provide global business leadership and management of the global customer relationship including teaming with the customer’s board, IT, digital, business unit and cloud leaders to build strategic relationships globally. • Lead, grow and develop a world-class multi-layer, international global account, collaborating with appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. • Articulate a clear vision and generate enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups within assigned accounts • Work at the most strategic level within the customer, implementing a broad strategy for earning customer adoption, acceptance and service implementation. • Develop formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting the activity and workloads running on AWS. About the team Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Job_Title: MGR/AVP, Business Controller, Treasury Financial Control & Advisory, Business Solutions & Control
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Finance looks beyond providing numbers. We add value in the decision-making process and facilitate the formulation of effective business strategies. We uphold the integrity of our financial records and ensure that the highest standards are applied in our reports. We provide financial analyses and insights to management and businesses to make informed decisions. We engage our stakeholders regularly to keep them abreast of the Bank's financial performance and development. Scope of Department & Role: Treasury Financial Control & Advisory function supports the Bank’s global treasury activities in the areas of Valuation, Regulatory controls, Position and P&L reconciliation, P&L reporting & analysis of the financial performance of the Global Treasury (GT) business. We perform independent control monitoring on the front office trading activities and supports the maintenance of GT Murex Portfolio tree. Key Responsibilities Engage end-users to understand business rules and logic, assess data sets requirements and translate into tangible solutions. Perform quality coding based on user business requirements and specifications to extract, transform and load data from source systems and other data sources into QlikView end user applications and/or other appropriate platforms. Manage end users’ expectations on solutioning requests with no compromise to internal controls, user acceptance testing and adhere to end user computing compliance & documentation. Perform daily control monitoring to ensure timely delivery of applications. Support our controllers to enable effective usage of our applications. Opportunities to participate in new projects, change initiatives to drive new ways of working.

Job_Title: Cloud Service Delivery & Support Engineer (AVP5/ M6)
Job_Descriptions: Job Summary Be an integral part of OCBC Group’s Cloud Service Engineering team to support & operate OCBC’s multi-cloud infrastructure and services. We leverage modern technology and stacks to support and scale the bank’s applications and provide lasting value to our customers. You will be at the forefront of this transformational platform, assisting our business and technology stakeholders take advantage of OCBC Cloud’s growing set of features and services to run their application workloads. As a Cloud Service Delivery & Support Engineer, you will be the go-to liaison responsible for solving our stakeholder’s cases and arming them with required tools and techniques to help them get the most out of OCBC Cloud. Would you like to learn and use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping your stakeholders understand Cloud, address their challenges and drive support-related projects that improve processes and experiences? If you fit the description, you might be the person we are looking for! Job responsibilities and what you might expect: Learn and use modern cloud technologies. Provide technical support on full stack of OCBC Cloud infrastructure and services (e.g. compute, storage, networking, application messaging, integration, etc.) Apply problem solving and troubleshooting techniques to identify, isolate the root cause and recover from reported problems. Partner with stakeholders to reproduce and provide long term solutions that resolve their issues. Lead stakeholder engagement and communications during support events. Drive support-related projects that improve Cloud support processes and user experience. Provide wikis/tutorials/videos and other technical support articles for the stakeholder community. Be the voice of our stakeholders in providing feedback to our internal Cloud Engineering teams on how to improve OCBC Cloud services. OCBC Cloud Service Engineering is a 24/7/365 operations and shift work will be required to include nights, weekends and holidays. *LI-GC

Job_Title: Director, Data & Analytics | Forensic & Litigation Consulting | Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Position Summary FTI’s Data & Analytics team (D&A) delivers strategic business solutions for clients requiring in-depth analysis of large, disparate sets of financial, operational, and transactional data.  Few organizations are prepared to cope with the large volume of information generated in today’s business environment, requiring corporations to take new approaches to assessing and prioritising what is relevant when managing critical cases and issues. The D&A team uses leading edge technologies and proven methodologies to identify, acquire, and transform massive amounts of complex and diverse information into workable databases, then uses FTI’s business and industry expertise to analyse problems or opportunities and identify solutions to achieve optimal outcomes for our clients. Key Responsibilities As a Director, you will develop in-depth knowledge of your clients' objectives and challenges in order to design and implement innovative strategies to assist them through their current difficulties and prepare them for the future. Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following: Effectively working with clients to develop the work plan for identifying, acquiring, synthesizing, mining and analysing relevant data. Identifying the relationships among multiple sources and types of data and organizing this information to facilitate effective data analysis. Designing and implementing complex financial database models to generate meaningful statistics and resolve disputes. Analysing and interpreting historical financial, operational, and transactional data. Supervising the day-to-day activities of projects including interaction with client personnel, FTI team members, and professionals from other firms involved in the engagement. About NCS NCS is a member of the Singtel Group and the leading information, communication and technology (ICT) service provider. across the Asia-Pacific region. We are passionate in delivering the best IT, data and analytics solutions to our clients in the various sectors – government, financial and commercial. We embrace the company's core values in everything we do and strongly believe that a strong pipeline of talent drives sustainable business success – the right people in the right roles, at the right time. Ultimately, we also believe that managing one's career is a partnership. At every stage of your career, you will find many avenues for learning and development with us at NCS. About Nucleus Our Nucleus talent development program is designed to help you kick start your tech career by building your foundation and deepening your specialisation through undergoing a sponsored structured program – eventually securing a Master of Technology degree with NUS-ISS. On top of the master’s degree, you will become proficient in digital technologies, system development and implementation through working with a dynamic team, in a fun and fast-paced environment. If you have strong data fundamentals, analytical skills, learning agility and positive working attitudes towards challenges, accelerate your Tech Career with us by embarking on an enriching and rewarding career path with NCS. What will you do? Translate customer pain-points into problem statements, develop analytics solutions, and engagingly present results and learnings to both technical and non-technical audiences Contribute to the building and maintaining of end-to-end data pipelines to bring information from source systems, harmonise and cleanse data to support analytics solutions Contribute to scoping of data inputs, data cleaning and pre-processing, feature engineering, building analytics solution, deploying to production, conducting testing, and improving analytics solution by iterations Participate in technical design sessions with cross-functional teams to define data process flow, data definition, data & analytics solution requirements and specifications Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide regular status reporting and support them to refine issues/problem statements and propose/evaluate relevant analytics solutions Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and analytics competencies that deliver work in waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies What do you need to succeed? Possess good communications skills to understand our customers' core business objectives and build end-to-end data centric solutions to address them Good critical thinking and problem-solving abilities Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments Expected to grow your skills and capabilities by becoming a SME within area of responsibility and scope of services and staying current on the new and emerging market offerings/technologies. Must-have: Master or Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Information Systems, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physic, or other related disciplines that possesses an analytical and quantitative component from a reputable institution. Basic competency in two or more of the following areas preferred: Data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI) SQL knowledge Programming or scripting language (e.g. Python, R, Java) Analytical software (e.g. SAS) Distributed architectures (e.g. HDFS, Hive) Ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication to team members and clients Ability to link industry specific business requirements to BI, Analytics and Big Data solutions Good to have: Experience with AWS, Azure, Cloudera (or other cloud services) Data pipeline and/or database development experience Knowledge of statistical modelling, predictive analytics or machine learning Hands-on experience setting up and using toolkits such as: Docker VMs Git SSH REST APIs. Certification in leading data analytics platforms such as: Tableau Qlik Informatica Talend Microsoft SAS IBM Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role.

Job_Title: Growth Lead (Assistant Director), OI Platform & PIXEL Products
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We are looking for a Growth Lead to drive the next phase for our two products: the Open Innovation Platform (OIP) and PIXEL incubation & innovation space. The OIP is our government platform matching corporates with real-world business problems to start-ups with game-changing solutions. PIXEL is a 28,000 ft facility with incubation space, 5G and AR/VR test-labs, and design thinking and UI/UX capability-building programmes. Together, our mission is to distribute innovation to corporates and build successful start-ups at scale, to ensure Singapore’s place in a digital future. The selected candidate will be reporting directly to the Director of Innovation. Why Join Us? Shape the ethos of being a start-up within government, being scrappy, running fast and lean, and failing forward You will have a hand in a transforming team to conceptualise, experiment, iterate and execute the OIP and PIXEL products for the next bound Excellent opportunity to put your hard-earned skills in action, backed by resources, to shape the growth trajectory of two products that will deliver socioeconomic impact to Singaporeans and Singapore-based companies. What you will be working on Develop, lead and own OIP and PIXEL’s 2.0 brand and marketing strategy (including positioning, customer archetypes, insights, jobs-to-be-done, KPIs) and plan (channels, content, activities) towards our business objectives. Set up a content powerhouse – lead and execute content strategy to grow the brand and users, focusing on but not limited to key channels (EDM, LinkedIn) and new channels identified. Work with in-house designers and agencies to define and execute the content strategy to drive user acquisition and engagement. Own full funnel marketing performance, integrating insights across online media (paid, owned, earned, shared) and offline (F2F account, events) to deliver a quality brand experience. Manage performance/media agencies to ensure continued optimisation for media sufficiency, efficiency and effectiveness. Partner closely with the Director (Innovation) to deliver the overarching platform strategy and roadmap. Deliver data-driven consumer insights that will dovetail into product sprints. Play the role of key integrator to drive and facilitate cross-functional initiatives towards common organisational outcomes Collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders, forging strategic partnerships with media owners, innovation and tech communities to amplify OIP and PIXEL’s voice. What we are looking for [ Proven Analytical and Communication Abilities ] About 10 years of experience in a strategic marketing role, executing digital marketing strategies with leadership experience. Strong at working with and influencing internal and cross-functional stakeholders, speaking eloquently to fulfil common business objectives. Experienced in managing agencies and budgeting. Outstanding analytical abilities (measure marketing effectiveness/efficiencies including brand trackers, messages and channels) and familiar with digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics and Mailchimp. Good storyteller to explain insights and data clearly, and inspire action. [ Independent Problem-Solver and Executor ] Action-oriented and strong sense of ownership to roll up your sleeves. Has experience developing, experimenting, iterating and executing end-to-end, holistic marketing plans. [ Passionate about the Mission ] User-centric and curious about our users and what makes them tick so as to improve our products. Relentless in cutting through blockers and getting things done. Ambiguity and challenges energise you. Possess a developmental mindset and experienced in leading teams to coach and share learnings, leveling up the team. [ Value-Adding Experience ] Worked in growth related roles at Startups, or marketing in CPGs or B2B businesses. Position and salary commensurate with experience.

What the role is You will build up internal technical competency and establish institutional knowledge to develop reference technical and architectural designs and plans for the redevelopment and rejuvenation of sport facilities through the review of the technical requirements that meets the desired performance, safety, sustainability and operations outcomes by conducting technical courses and seminars. What you will be working on In this role, You will, Assess the needs of the stakeholders and review the project brief and technical requirements to meet the desired performance, safety, and operations outcomes. Develop reference technical and architectural designs and plans for the redevelopment and rejuvenation of sport facilities; especially in specialised fields such as swimming pools, indoor sports hall, stadium, etc. Establish institutional knowledge of specialised technical fields for sports to ensure operations efficiency, user safety, improved building maintainability, and environmental sustainability. Review the technical solutions and proposals to ensure that it meets the performance, safety, sustainability and operations outcomes. Custodian of all the technical BIM drawings and repositories for new and existing sport facilities. Ensure that the project teams update the BIM drawings during project rejuvenation and redevelopment. Knowledge of relevant statutory requirements and compliances for buildings. Advise on environmental and regulatory requirements, and technical design affecting the projects. Conduct technical courses and seminars to build up internal technical competencies. Commercialise the technical expertise to private / public sector developments. What we are looking for We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following; Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Building/Construction Management, Project Management, Quality Surveying, and/or equivalent. More than 5 years of relevant working experience with strong knowledge and understanding of building construction and technical design. Experience in government procurement, familiarity with building and construction regulations, technical sustainability solutions, and sport/recreational facilities operations would be an advantage. Experience in reviewing 6 to 8 projects concurrently. The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2 or 3-year contract in the first instance.

What the role is The mission of Housing & Development Board (HDB) is to provide affordable, quality housing and a great living environment where communities thrive. To achieve its mission, HDB aims to be data-driven to the core and adopt evidence-based decision making in developing better housing policies service, improving service delivery, and optimising operations. What you will be working on You will: Work with application developers and business users to identify critical data elements to be captured. Drive data quality improvement initiatives and ensure that data quality meets established standards. Perform data modelling and ensure data is modelled to meet the business requirements and easy for people to understand and use. Advice and work with stakeholders to categorise business data in accordance to existing data classification standards. Work with relevant stakeholders to review and enhance existing data governance and data security related processes in accordance to established data governance standards Review business processes and/or systems controls required to mitigate data security risks as data security is paramount What we are looking for Background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, IT, data management or equivalent. Experience or knowledge in industry standard data modelling and database design (e.g. DAMA). Experience or knowledge in developing and documenting data-driven solutions - including metadata systems, data dictionaries, databases and applications. Experience in big data and associated platform / technology knowledge would be an advantage. Knowledge in data encryption, security governance techniques and methodology would be an advantage. Knowledge in data synchronisation methodology and controls (on premise and cloud environment) would be an advantage. Good team player who possesses drive and initiative. Good written / oral communication skills to effectively interact with different stakeholders to gather and document business requirements. Able to work independently under pressure. Able to think strategically when planning data modelling and data quality roadmap would be an advantage Applicants without the required working experience but have the drive and passion to learn and deliver may apply. Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

What the role is Singapore’s economy is digitalising, and an effective wireless communications infrastructure is key to support Singapore’s digital economy. As a member of the IMDA Telecom Cybersecurity Specialist team, you will be applying your expertise in Telecom Cybersecurity to support various operational and developmental activities, with strong focus on 5G. What you will be working on Key Responsibilities: Provide advisory and technical consultancy to IMDA programmes/projects, in relation to cybersecurity areas such as threat vulnerability and risk assessment and ongoing cybersecurity improvements Responsible to provide recommendations pertaining to cybersecurity in terms of the potential solutions, implementation options, system architecture and design for cloud, enterprise and telecommunications systems & infrastructure Work closely with the various cross-functional teams to establish, formulate, and establish the information security goals to develop appropriate cybersecurity risk assessment for the digital infrastructure (including cloud, enterprise, or telecommunications systems & network) Engagement with industry and conduct technical experimentations and trials of cybersecurity solutions/products that may be suitable for deployment in digital infrastructure Stay abreast of emerging cloud technologies and digital trends What we are looking for Qualifications and Skills: Minimum 5 years of experience in relevant field(s) such as cybersecurity, telecommunications A Bachelor's degree in Communications Engineering/ Computer Science / Computer Engineering (or equivalent) with specialisation in cyber security is preferred. Ability to multi-task and work as a team in a fast-paced and complex work environment, with minimal supervision Position will commensurate with experience. Job_Title: Manager/Senior Manager, Process Assurance, Infrastructure Standards
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. Responsibilities You will be reporting to the Team lead, Process Assurance, Sport Infrastructure Group (SIG). In this role, you will be part of the team to build a robust internal control system by putting in place a structured project management process, with relevant and sufficient resources, tools and guidelines to support the infrastructure development project team in delivering the sport facilities, so as to achieve the objective of the organisation. In this role, you will Implement robust process on the project management spectrum from project initiation, pre-implementation, contract management, project deliverable to post-implementation. Implement checks to ensure project milestone is achieved as per the project management process. Provide assurance on compliance to MOF Instruction Manual (IM), BCA guides/ policies and the Public Sector Standard Conditions of Contract for Construction Works (PSSCOC), Building and Construction Industry Security of Payment Act (BCISOPA) and its regulations etc. Provide assurance to the management team on the compliance to internal control system. Provide advice to the project team on the adequacy of compliance. Be a proactive process assurance partner that not only identifies risks but gives recommendations based on real project issues. Design, manage and facilitate learning experience/ coaching/ sharing platform. Ensure documentations are in place and knowledge management and sharing is done adequately. Job_Title: Assistant Vice President, Senior Digital Analyst
Job_Descriptions: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. We are building and expanding the best digital bank in ASEAN. Traditional retail banking is changing rapidly, and will change even more in the next 10 years. We fundamentally rethink the retail banking strategy, business model and proposition, to stay relevant and keep up with the challenges that lie ahead in this rapidly evolving landscape. TMRW (pronounced as “tomorrow”) empowers the digital generation with a full suite of banking solutions through a smart, mobile-only app. Our mission is to build and expand the best digital bank in ASEAN. Launched in Indonesia and Thailand as the first mobile only digital bank by United Overseas Bank (UOB) in ASEAN, TMRW offers innovative and simple solutions to help customers stay one step ahead of their finances. Our business model is powered by next-generation artificial intelligence, machine learning, data analytics, user interface design and smartphone capabilities. These include our own digital technology innovations as well as solutions provided through our collaboration with FinTech partners. We embrace a competitive strategy that focuses on customer intimacy, measured by net-promoter-score (NPS). Since launch, TMRW has won many awards in total, including: Best Digital Bank in ASEAN, Best Digital Bank for Customer Experience and Best Bank for Millennials. As we enter our next phase of growth, we are looking for entrepreniurial and open minded team players who are keen to learn, enjoy taking on multiple roles, and willing to step out of your comfort zone. You will be the catalyst of change for UOB and be part of our exciting roadmap in the next chapter of growth. Get ready for an exciting career path in a start-up environment that is diverse and fast-paced, where you will have the opportunity to be engaged in transformative programs, and collaborate with business, and technology teams as well as regional and country stakeholders. We believe in empowering our people, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do and their successes. Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms. We are a team of 200 builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients! We are looking for an amazingly well-rounded Business Operations Associate to help quickly grow our business globally! As a Business Operations Associate at Sleek, you will be part of a highly collaborative and amazing team, with exposure to exciting operations & core business projects. You should be highly organised, detail-oriented and most importantly, personable with a strong mindset to try out new approaches to solve unique problems. Position Duties Support the full cycle of technology projects from problem identification to scoping, requirements gathering, design, business readiness, testing and implementation. Conduct root-cause analysis to understand where we need to improve in order to achieve exceptional customer experience and to optimize business processes. Conduct business process mapping & analysis. Perform data & gap analysis to continuously evaluate processes, org setup and workflows in order to improve operational performance. Ensure project objectives have been met and proper project closure with complete lessons learned and new processes documented. Assist in cross-functional collaboration across all operations teams to deliver valuable projects. More about Sleek! At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 15 nationalities and spoken languages. We consider the company’s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Our corporate social responsibility is a passion we take very seriously as an opportunity to make the world a better place. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity. If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you! Requirements Performance Standards 1 to 5 years experience in Business Process management and improvement. Willingness to learn, with a curious, and data driven mindset. Be highly collaborative as the role will work closely with other department members to align and execute process improvement and automation projects. Possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a flair for project management. Strong teamwork, organizational and interpersonal skills. Strong Analytical skills. Benefits Performance Bonus Work From Home Flexi Health Care

AssemblyAI is an AI company - we build powerful models to transcribe and understand audio data, exposed through simple APIs. Hundreds of companies, and thousands of developers, use our APIs to both transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning. We’ve been growing at breakneck speed, and are backed by leading investors including Y Combinator’s AI Fund, Patrick and John Collision (Founders of Stripe), Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), and Daniel Gross (Entrepreneur & Investor in companies including GitHub, Uber, Coinbase, SpaceX, Instacart, Notion, and Cruise Automation). AssemblyAI’s Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP. Join our world-class, remote team and help us build an iconic deep learning company. The Role: AssemblyAI is growing quickly, and we’re searching for a Deep Learning Researcher to join our team. With significant investment and strong leadership to fuel our growth, it’s the perfect time to join the AssemblyAI team! In this role you’ll have the opportunity to: Continually push the state of the art in speech recognition and NLP. You will conduct cutting edge deep learning research in speech and NLP. Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - and we’re looking for the best deep learning engineers and researchers to help us continually push the state of the art in speech recognition to get to human level performance. Research & train AssemblyAI’s deep learning models. You will work with large scale data sets to research and train deep learning models for speech recognition. You will research and develop novel algorithms and techniques to advance the state of the art in natural language understanding. You will conduct research and experiments in order to improve accuracy of our Deep Learning ASR pipeline. You will also dig into weaknesses and failure points of our current ASR models in order to identify further areas for improvement. Be part of a world-class team of creative researchers & engineers. You will help strengthen the position of AssemblyAI as a leading company in AI research. Our deep learning team is a tight knit group of creative researchers and engineers, who are not afraid to try unconventional ideas. You will also work with the broader speech recognition team as we continually strive to match human level accuracy. Our Team: We are a fully remote, global, autonomous team made up of top AI researchers, engineers, and experienced startup operators. Our culture is super collaborative, low-ego, transparent, and fast-paced. We want to win - and have a flat organization where everyone can openly share ideas (regardless of their title or position) in order to get the best idea. As a remote company, our team members are given a lot of trust and autonomy to work where and how they want. We look for people to join our team who are ambitious, curious, and self-motivated, and we put a lot of trust and autonomy into everyone on our team. We want to empower everyone to do their best work with whatever tools, structures, or resources they need to perform at their highest potential. Requirements 2 - 3 years of experience in Deep Learning research & development 2+ years of experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow Experience training large models on multiple GPUs In-depth understanding of application of deep learning networks like RNNs, CNNs, and Transformers Preferred Experience (any of the following): Speaker diarization Multilingual speech recognition Asynchronous (async) speech recognition Real-time speech recognition Wav2letter++, Wav2vec, CTC, RNNTs, and/or LAS Skills: Detail-oriented, analytical, and creative problem solver with a passion for quality processes Ability to work independently, raise issues and take corrective action A keen eye for detail Benefits Competitive Salary Equity 100% Remote team Unlimited PTO $1K budget for your home office setup New Macbook Pro (or PC if you prefer) 3-4x/year company paid team retreats

We are looking for a self-starting, goal oriented individual to join our HQ Finance Team. As an Associate Finance Business Partner, you will get the opportunity to deliver high quality accounting, impact business decisions and strategic direction by providing management and senior leaders with accurate, analytical and insightful analysis to achieve our shared strategic and financial goals. WE OFFER We offer an exciting and attractive career, in an ambitious and competitive environment with the possibility of continuous professional and personal development. Sealand Asia offers a fast paced, challenging and truly international atmosphere. The environment is dynamic with focus on high performance, results, and respect for our employees. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of the HQ Finance as an Associate Finance Business Partner (FBP) in Sealand Asia. HQ Finance is the focal point for management reporting, external reporting, financial information and forecasting and budgeting. As a FBP, you will work with multiple aspects of financial reporting, process and system optimization, financial planning and analysis as well as communication towards management. You will be working together with a pool of highly skilled and talented people in an international environment. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES As part of the HQ Finance Team, you will be active involved in driving quality reporting and support cross functions teams through proactiveness and effective communication. Key Responsibilities · Delivers accurate, timely and aligned information on Sales, General & Administration (SG&A) performance across functions, cost types and Sealand Asia countries. · Own various processes including Travel Expenses Management (TEM) and SG&A reporting to ensure good quality on the figures and same accounting treatments within the countries. · Be active in driving actions plans for improving data quality and performances across processes and functions when required. · Provide insights and transparency on the FTE and SG&A Costs to various functions and countries managers to allow business planning on resources and non-operational costs efficiency. · Be involved and responsible in financial planning and analysis which include budgeting and forecasting and close liaising with management to sign off the SG&A estimates and budgets. · Provide forward looking analysis on SG&A estimates with monthly SG&A reports on dashboard and readily to engage different functions to obtain the right set of information for SGA planning and performance. · Responsible for providing the required governance for working capital performance management with cost efficiency focus on SG&A across Sealand Asia countries. Ensure standard reporting landscape is adhered to and consistently applied on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis, as one set of data. · Drive aligned and accurate Service Agreements across Sealand Asia Countries, LOC and CPH counterparts. · Separate focus area on 3rd party Agents and AR performance management including customers’ claims, write off analysis and support the commercial teams with Global Shared Service (GSC) Teams ; · Also involved to ensure local statutory reporting requirements are met and filed in accordance with local accounting policies. · Following the control framework of the company focusing on working capital area, ensuring that control activities are properly executed (incl. fraud awareness) and ensuring feedback to the Management on control deficiencies in local control environment. · Validate financial impact of business decisions (e.g. accounting impact, cash flow impact, profitability, financial risk and tax exposure). · Liaise with external auditors for statutory audits. · Take on any finance related projects as and when required. · Address on-demand business issues. Who we are looking for We are looking for a professional individual who can challenge the status quo at all levels of the organization. Highly preferred bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting. Minimum 3 years of professional experience in similar corporate structure reporting financials or similar metrics for business performance. Shipping industry experience is preferred with insight from country/cluster organizations as well as geographical coverage of Asia Pacific. Advanced Microsoft office software skills, particularly Access, Excel and PowerPoint for reports and presentations. Experience with building Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tools highly preferred. Great analytical skillset, challenger mindset, high drive and focus on personal development. Skills in advanced data analysis and problem solving are added advantage. Strong sense of urgency and drive to deliver quality in your work - all at the same time Track record in driving high performance through teams Skilled in written and spoken English Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills being able to work with both management and employees in a large organization Self-starter with a high motivation level to take on new tasks and ensure timely and successful execution Open and positive attitude Outgoing, outspoken and a winning personality

Job_Title: Partner Operations Manager, YouTube (English, Bahasa) - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: YouTube At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. The role: Partner Operations Manager, YouTube (English, Bahasa) - Singapore Additional Role Description: The Partner Development team ensures a great experience for YouTube partners and creators. The team includes Partner Operations, Technology Services, Creator and Artist Development, and YouTube Spaces. This team embodies a partner first mindset, whether it’s building custom tools, providing education to get the most from the platform, or helping creators to grow their channel to the next level. Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, the YouTube Partner Development and Services team provides seamless support to our partners, creators, and artists on YouTube from around the world. As a Partner Operations Manager, you will provide YouTube support to managed partners (e.g., media companies, music labels, creators, artists, etc). You will become a YouTube product expert, solve the day-to-day issues of our partners, and identify common trends that our partners face. You will also be responsible for advocating on behalf of our partners to cross-functional teams in order to drive product solutions, and for developing process improvements that enhance internal operations. You will work closely with other partner-facing teams to provide value-add services to help increase partner happiness and growth. Responsibilities: - Provide operational support for partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication. - Serve as a consultant to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product. Work with assigned Strategic Partner Managers and Partner Technology Managers to develop business plans and share insights for partner growth. - Drive, measure, and analyze overall partner performance as well as streamline operational workflows and process improvements. - Identify key metrics to evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively. - Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 2 years of experience in a client-facing, customer support or account management role. - Experience working in a project/program management or scaled solutions capacity in a technology/media company. - Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa fluently in order to communicate with external partners and creators. Preferred qualifications: - Experience making constructive suggestions and coming up with innovative ways to scale initiatives. - Working knowledge of SQL and spreadsheets. - Ability to manage priorities and stay organized in a fast-paced environment. - Ability to troubleshoot technical issues and effectively communicate complex topics. - Excellent communication, presentation planning, and time management skills, with attention to detail.

Duties and Responsibilities of A Condominium Manager 1. Guide and supervise the technician and executive in the carrying out of all his duties. 2. To invite for tenders and quotations for various maintenance services and maintenance repair and project works. 3. To arrange for review of sum insured for insurances. 4. Recommend annual salary review for in-house staff. 5. Review all contracts, agreements, and insurance 2 months before their expiry and recommend renewal or call for quotation/tender. 6. Arrange and attend Council Meetings and Annual General Meetings. 7. Preparation of all correspondence and Minutes of Meetings. 8. Staff recruitment. 9. Plan and recommend periodic maintenance works. 10. Arrange for annual audit of accounts. 11. Advise Council if expenditure is within the budget approved at General Meetings. 12. Review monthly statements and advise Council. 13. Recommend appropriate actions to be taken against defaulters with assistance from solicitors. 14. Proposed annual maintenance budget and sinking fund provision and present them to Council. 15. Approve and authorize paying of outgoings including taxes. 16. Approve works/purchase orders. 17. Advise Council on the provisions of the legislation relating to property management. 18. Advise Council on placement and transfer of fund when appropriate. 19. Conduct regular inspection with the term contractors (cleaning, landscape, swimming pool, pest control, fire protection system and lift) to ensure that the services are carried out/maintained to the standard set by the Management and/or the authorities. 20. Propose/recommend improvement, repairs and upgrading works when appropriate and ensure such are carried out properly when approved. 21. Supervise the works (excluding repainting and structural appraisal). 22. Propose/recommend any other improvement and addition as and when directed by the Council. 23. Where approved, contractors should be invited, shown around and requested to submit quotations. 24. Oversee the carrying out of these works. 25. Receive and attend to complaints by residents and owners on common area only. 26. Advise and assist whenever possible, complaints beyond the Corporation’s purview (this refers to problems in individual units). 27. Maintain a complaints log book. 28. Check regularly to ensure residents comply with by-laws. 29. Report to the Management any breach and recommend appropriate enforcement action. 30. Attend to submission for approval of renovation work in individual unit. Bring up to Council for approval if necessary. 31. Maintain records of all check lists, service, maintained reports, plans and manuals. 32. Refer all directions from the government authorities to the Managing Agent. These include the FSB, BCD, BAU, PWD, P & R, MOE, etc. 33. Monitor PUB consumption and readings. Others To carry out any other duties as and when required by the Management Council. * Location: Upper Changi Road East * 5.5. Days Work Week with Alternate Saturday Off

Neuron is the leading shared micromobility operator in APAC and has also expanded into the United Kingdom, South Korea and Canada. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe, convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting. Neuron launched the world’s first docked e-scooter in Singapore in 2016 and the first shared e-scooter programme in 2017. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters, which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts, particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in fifteen cities across ANZ, three in the United Kingdom, and most recently have successfully launched in four cities in Canada. The Role: You will be based in HQ Singapore, working in a fast-paced, exciting and highly rewarding environment that will provide plenty of opportunities for personal growth. You will be reporting to the Financial Controller and will work closely with the internal teams in Finance, Supply Chain, Product, Software Engineering and external solutions integrator and consultants to help with planning, designing, building and operating Neuron Mobility’s Oracle NetSuite ERP system. What You’ll Do: Be a go-to resource for all internal NetSuite related tasks. Work with stakeholders and external consultants, to plan, review, and revise feature configurations and customizations of NetSuite to meet evolving business and operational needs. Technical and administrative ownership of NetSuite responsible for NetSuite data management which includes governance and control, security and integrity. Perform day-to-day operation, maintenance, project, change request and support tasks for all NetSuite application and the ecosystems. Support requests for new/update/termination of users/roles, partners and associated accounts/roles, Workflow design, maintenance and troubleshoot Research, recommend, and work with third-party applications, interfaces and vendors as required Maintain the System & Users with Adequate & Appropriate roles & permissions. Ensure system compliance with Company’s policies, procedures and protocols for system standards, customizations, and changes Aid users to develop and produce reports and dashboards and collaborate with users to design and build KPI’s. What You'll Need: 5 years of experience in NetSuite administration, support and management experience in global operations Experienced in Saved Searches, SuiteScript, SuiteTalk, Workflow and RESTLets, JavaScript experience is required as well as a working knowledge of HTML, XML, and SQL Working knowledge of csv imports, user provisioning, defining roles, report analytics and scheduling scripts Project management experience A solid understanding of the Finance / Accounting, Supply Chain Management functional areas is essential for the performance of this role Our Values Make It Happen Drive to deliver results with the highest impact and be committed to follow through. Continuously optimise through collaboration to achieve the best collective outcomes. Be Proactive Take active steps and be the driver to improve things, for yourself, your team and the cities we serve. Relish the chance if this leads you outside your normal scope. Trust Facts Over Opinions Decisions should be evidence-based. Assess situations fairly, using reason and logic rather than unverified opinions wherever possible. Stay Curious Ask questions, challenge assumptions, learn from mistakes and be ready to leave behind what you thought you knew before. Do More With Less Both time and resources are finite. Balance your priorities and think strategically about how you can maximise your impact and the return on investment of your resources. If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story, we want you riding for our team! Neuron Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to making all employment decisions including recruitment, appointment and promotion decisions on the basis of business needs, individual qualifications, and merit. The company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are dedicated to the continued personal and professional growth of our employees. We protect all of our employees regardless of race, nationality, ethnicity, politics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, social origin, physical and mental disability, religion or belief, marital or domestic partnership status, family or parental status and any other status recognised and protected by the law and regulations of where we operate.
