The role We are looking for an ambitious and success-driven Business Development Executive, with experience in consistently meeting and exceeding sales targets. You will be working on the frontline of our commercial team, finding opportunities to sell our industry leading anti-money laundering software. As the owner of the first stage of the sales process you will require fantastic communication skills and a high level of professionalism. Ultimately you will be responsible for the critical step of engaging and booking meetings with world leading businesses. You'll be working in an extremely fast paced environment with the expectation to create your own work, and as such will require a hungry and motivated attitude. We are looking for someone based in Singapore to work in a hybrid work from home/office based role as local regulations allow. About us Since launching in 2014, we have been on a mission to neutralize the risk of money laundering, terrorist financing, corruption, and other financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $88m in funding, have four global hubs located in New York, London, Singapore and Cluj-Napoca and are backed by Ontario Teachers’, Index Ventures and Balderton Capital. We aim to grow to over 350 employees in the next 12 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 500 enterprises across 75 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission as the financial industry’s leading source of AI-driven financial crime risk data and detection technology. No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously! Focus on the Team - We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble Kaizen - We're Curious, Proactive and Agile Deliver Results - We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none - Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor. Responsibilities Planning & Research: You will be provided with a territory and named accounts, however it will be your responsibility to maintain this list with up-to date and relevant account information. Most importantly you will have to be strategic in managing and planning your time and activities. You will have full control of planning your approach but it should be detailed in how you spend your time and correlate strongly with the expectations surrounding hitting your targets. All plans should be in a review cycle where we analyse their success and continuously refine, for ongoing improvement. Prospecting: You will be expected to generate leads and meetings on a daily basis. In this role the work doesn’t just come to you, your job will be to leverage our content, technology and industry experience in order to book quality meetings. You will need to engage with senior decision makers from within the biggest and most ambitious companies worldwide. You should deliver tailored and impactful verbal or written messages in order to educate them on our value proposition, which will ultimately secure meetings and qualify opportunities. You should be confident in using a variety of prospecting methods including but not limited to; Phonecalls, email, social media, industry events & video. Team Contribution: This is a role with independent targets, however you will be required to work strongly in a team. First and foremost you will be working closely with your AE, who you will be booking meetings for, therefore must be able to effectively communicate your own plans whilst following their advice and instructions. Finally the commercial team at CA are extremely team orientated, therefore we often come together to share our experiences and learnings, as a valued member of the team you will be required to communicate your opinions and share stories to receive feedback of your own. Learning & Continuous Improvement: You will be working in a niche market that is quite complex in nature. You will have the support of an experienced team and numerous amounts of training materials. However in order to excel in this role you will be required to commit to self-learning and continuous training. Areas of industry learning will cover product knowledge, competitor knowledge and a deep understanding of the market and personas you will be prospecting in to. This also extends outside of the industry as you will be expected to continuously improve your ever-expanding sales skills. To help with this you will receive an annual personal training budget and paid training days. The Ideal Candidate We’re looking for an ambitious and highly motivated individual that doesn’t take themselves too seriously, to join our team of high achievers. You should be: An all encompassing communicator: In this role the majority of your responsibilities revolve around some form of communication, be that external or internal. You must have fantastic spoken and written communication, as well as an ability to tailor your communication style to align with a variety of ages, backgrounds and personalities. Fiercely competitive, yet gracious in defeat: You should strive to be the best or No.1, if you don’t achieve that you should demonstrate an ability to learn from your experiences, in order to do better next time. You should be hungry to smash your set targets and not shy away from a challenge. A thirst for knowledge and improvement : You should be driven to improve your skills and expand your knowledge. You should be viewing this role as a stepping stone in your SAAS sales career. You’ll be working for an ever-expanding company where given the right attitude and results your career can progress extremely fast. An entrepreneurial spirit: You will need to have a keen commercial instinct in order to seek out opportunities and prioritise your time most effectively. 12 months B2B SAAS experience would be ideal, however outside of that the right candidate must be able to demonstrate natural sales acumen and past experience of smashing targets. Be an ‘independent’ team player: Given the autonomous nature of this role, you will be required to work independently, both thinking and standing on your own two feet. However, we pride ourselves on having a sales team lacking in selfish behaviour, instead creating an environment of unity and camaraderie. Therefore, those who excel in this role and business are those just as competent working individually as they are amongst an amazing high-spirited team. Benefits Competitive salary Stock options Unlimited holiday plan Flexible working hours, and remote working opportunity CPF contribution Company Health Care Plan Training and development budget

Are you a biomedical researcher motivated to pursue an outstanding career in cancer research? Cancer will affect more than 1 in 3 Singaporeans. At the Cancer Science Institute (CSI), our mission is to be at the global forefront of research to overcome this scourge. Our innovative international faculty, cutting-edge facilities, supportive working environment and competitive package together enable each of our staff to realize their maximum potential. We now seek a Senior Research Scientist to join the team of our new Director, Prof. Ashok Venkitaraman, who has recently joined us from the University of Cambridge (see https://www.csi.nus.edu.sg/web/ashok-venkitaraman/ ). This is an exciting opportunity to work closely with a world-leading cancer researcher to undertake pioneering research on the role of genome instability in human carcinogenesis (eg., see Venkitaraman Science (2014) PMID:24675954 and Venkitaraman DNA Repair (2019) PMID:31337537). ESSENTIAL qualifications include: (1) a PhD with 3 years’ relevant post-doctoral experience, (2) strong track record of research achievement evidenced by high-quality publications in a relevant field, (3) high-level experience in hands-on use of a wide range of relevant research methods, (4) skills in working independently and creatively to solve experimental problems and (5) effective communication and presentation skills, with experience in communicating scientific work including scientific papers, presentations and reports. Preference will be given to candidates with: (1) Previous experience in computational approaches to the analysis of (epi)genomic, transcriptomic or proteomic alterations in cancer or other diseases; (2) Familiarity with the development of phenotypic assays for genetic or chemical screening, involving the use of flow cytometry, high-throughput high-content microscopy, and/or advanced fluorescence microscopy, or (3) Previous experience with genetically engineered murine models. Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our NUS Career Portal including (1) a covering letter that explains why you are suited to this post, (2) a detailed CV, and (3) the contact details of 3 professional referees including your last position. Website: www.csi.nus.edu.sg Applications will be considered until the position is filled. We will only contact candidates who are shortlisted. Covid-19 Message At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required. With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore’s legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.[1] [1] MOM Updated advisory on COVID-vaccination at the Workplace, subject to changes in accordance with the national COVID-19 measures

As a MPO Specialist, you will be responsible for executing end-to-end order book management, communicate effectively to relevant stakeholders, and taking initiative to identify risk and opportunities for Nike and our partners. You will succeed by utilizing reporting and insights to drive timely delivery of all Nike products to support Nike profitability. You will communicate with, develop, and maintain positive relationships with internal cross functional partners through report interpretation, tools, phone and email. You will implement desk level orderbook tasks to deliver overall orderbook and business KPIs. Key Accountabilities • Respond to questions regarding order status and tracking information, working with internal partners to resolve moderately complex customer issues, such as pricing, delivery status, routing, rejections, holds. • Access, execute, and leverage standard and ad hoc reports to support execution. • Proactively track product delivery, order fill rates, validity, delivery, and returns activities. • Maintain upstream & downstream data integrity. • Drive day-to-day problem-solving activities, resolving & escalating issues as required. • Communicate & Influence key stakeholders on existing processes/capabilities. • Provide peer mentorship and training. Job_Descriptions: CAO– AFC SG Business Line Anti Financial Crime Officer (Wealth Management) – AVP Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: The Singapore Anti-Money Laundering Department, part of Anti Financial Crime, supports Deutsche Bank businesses in Singapore in managing AML risk, is responsible for ensuring related processes are in place and that all policies, procedures and guidelines conform to internal DB policies and MAS regulations. The operations in Singapore include a Branch and capital markets services licensees. For candidates with the relevant seniority or experience, additional regional responsibilities will be conferred. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and well being at its center. You can expect: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. Decide on new or existing Singapore relationships that are escalated by the local on boarding staff or deciding to escalate further. Assist in the maintenance of the Singapore or entity-level AML policies, procedures and AML Compliance program, as well as the annual Risk Analysis and the coordination of updates to Regional/Global AML. Assist in the fulfillment of local regulatory information requests from MAS and CAD, or within regulatory inspections. Assist in the Suspicious Transaction Reporting process to investigate AML Transaction Monitoring and other alerts including hits against the payment filter, and ensure suspicious transactions in Singapore are reported to the authorities and appropriately logged. Providing or assisting the provision of training on local regulatory requirements and internal policies, along with producing training materials. Private bank experience is preferred Good stakeholder management Degree qualified Relevant AML or related certifications (desirable) (CAMS, CFE, IntDipAML) Excellent technical AML knowledge skills and experience, and demonstrated hands-on experience Understanding one or more of the business areas of investment banking, corporate banking, trade finance, asset management and/or wealth management, and risk profile of each category. Strong analytical skills Strong interpersonal and influencing skills Customer service orientation Attention to detail. Performance orientation Teamwork and communication Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks under pressure. Job Title Senior Procurement Project Manager Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Join Philips Domestic Appliances business, a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion sales in very successful home care, kitchen appliances, coffee, and garment care products. Learn and contribute to the success of world market leader in garment care. Add value to product research and development processes. Interact with international product development, marketing, supply chain and manufacturing teams. You are responsible for: Representing procurement in a development center and ensures early supplier involvement, supplier selection and overall procurement support in new development projects. Driving cost savings and sourcing plan in new product development in close cooperation with R&D, Marketing, Quality, New Product Introduction (NPI) and Supply Chain Management (SCM). Identifying opportunities in the new product design process to improve the design decision making and supports price negotiations with fact-based information and opportunities to drive short and / or long-term product cost reduction improvement. Leading DfX (design for excellence) conventions for the assigned business and provides should-cost assessments for newly proposed products. Driving RFQ process based on commodity strategy and Supplier Selection Process together with the Commodity Teams. Ensuring potential risks (cost, quality, availability) in new development projects are controlled and mitigated. Supporting Supplier Quality Manager in new supplier component release process as part of the Advanced Quality Plan (AQP), including compliance and sustainability aspects. Aligning needs with competitive landscape and technology roadmaps. Providing input for make or buy analysis and supports the in/outsourcing process (e.g. knowledge transfer, supplier ramp-up). Providing input to the Commodity Teams regarding the supply base characteristics based on business requirements. Ensuring that optimized TCO (cost, quality, availability) are assured in product development / business creation and through their full life cycle, utilizing DFX. You are part of Philips Domestic Appliances Procurement team. This role will be based in Singapore and directly report to the Procurement Lead of Garment Care, based in Singapore. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Bachelor degree or above, major in Engineering, Business Management or Supply Chain / Procurement preferred. At least 10 - 15 years’ experience on procurement management in global companies / organizations, with experience on new product development or NPI project, Value Engineering, commodity management, and manufacturing environment. Good stakeholder engagement and convincing/influencing skills, comfortable working with cross functions including R&D, Marketing, Quality & Regulatory, and Legal/IP. A team player who is both proactive and cooperative; easily gains trust and support of peers; encourages collaboration and challenges constructively. Prepared to travel up to 10%-20% of the time. Fluent in verbal and written English, and Chinese Mandarin a plus as liaising with China counterparts is required. In return, we offer you A meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routines. Why should you join Philips Domestic Appliances? Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world. In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves. In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale.  Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers.
